Activity: Arrive at the office. Check emails and financial news. Prepare for the meeting with @AUDIT-1.
Meet with @AUDIT-1 (External Auditor) to discuss the fund's first audit. Review the audit scope, timeline, and documentation requirements. Address any questions or concerns from the auditor.

Based on the meeting with @AUDIT-1, refine the audit preparation plan. Assign specific tasks to other team members as needed (e.g., @COMP-1 for compliance-related documentation, @QRES-1 for performance calculation details).
Follow up on the email sent to @LEGAL-1 and @COMP-1 regarding legal interpretation of SEC regulations on fund valuation. If no response, send a reminder.
Review the fund's compliance procedures with @COMP-1 to ensure alignment with accounting standards. Focus on areas related to anti-money laundering (AML) and know your customer (KYC) requirements.
Work on refining the procedures for tracking fund expenses, incorporating feedback from @COO-1 and @AUDIT-1. Specifically address the documentation requirements for different types of expenses.
Update the accounting and reporting framework document based on the discussions with @AUDIT-1 and @COMP-1. Ensure the document is clear, concise, and easy to understand.
